page.title: 09Social Problems in Shepshed
page.content: Life in{Shepshed}in 1985 is far from perfect. These are some of the things that people are worried about. The{vandalism}in Shepshed seems to be getting worse. Bus stops, flower beds, young trees, schools and other public places suffer damage regularly. {Dangerous driving}causes trouble. Noise from motorbikes, speeding cars and incovenient parking create problems.{Graffiti}(writing on walls) is spoiling Shepshed. Public facilities are being defaced by youths who have nothing better to do. Recently{glue-sniffing}has become a serious problem. Young people inhale the fumes from solvent-based glue, which make them light headed and often violent. Shepshed often looks disgusting because of the amount of {rubbish}thrown onto the ground, in spite of the litter bins provided.
